org.codehaus.preon
Interface Codec<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object the Codec is able to decode/encode.
All Known Subinterfaces:
ExtendedCodec<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
EnumCodec, FixedLengthStringCodec, LazyLoadingCodecDecorator.LazyLoadingCodec, ListBasedMapCodec, NullTerminatedStringCodec, NumericCodec, ObjectCodec, SelectFromCodec, SwitchingCodec
public interface Codec<T>

The interface to be implemented by objects that are able to decode/encode objects.

Author:
Wilfred Springer

Method Summary
 T decode(BitBuffer buffer, Resolver resolver, Builder builder)
          Decodes a value from the BitBuffer.
 void encode(T value, BitChannel channel, Resolver resolver)
          Encodes the object to the BitChannel.
 CodecDescriptor getCodecDescriptor()
          Returns an object that is capable of rendering a description of the data structure encoded/decoded by this Codec.
 Expression<Integer,Resolver> getSize()
          Returns an expression that is expected to return the number of bits occupied by objects created by this Codec, as a function of the context to which variables will be resolved.
 Class<?> getType()
          Returns the (common super) type of object constructed by this Codec.
 Class<?>[] getTypes()
          Returns an array of types constructed potentially by this Codec.
 

Method Detail

decode

T decode(BitBuffer buffer,
         Resolver resolver,
         Builder builder)
         throws DecodingException
Decodes a value from the BitBuffer.

Parameters:
buffer - The BitBuffer containing the data from which a value will be decoded.
resolver - The object capable of resolving variable references, when required.
builder - The object responsible for creating default instances of objects, when needed. (In reality, this is most likely going to be important to ObjectCodecFactories only, but in order to make sure the Builder arrives there, we need to have the ability to pass it in.
Returns:
The decoded value.
Throws:
DecodingException - If the Codec fails to decode the value.

encode

void encode(T value,
            BitChannel channel,
            Resolver resolver)
            throws IOException
Encodes the object to the BitChannel.

Parameters:
value - The object to encode.
channel - The channel to receive the encoded representation.
resolver - The object providing access to the context.
Throws:
IOException

getSize

Expression<Integer,Resolver> getSize()
Returns an expression that is expected to return the number of bits occupied by objects created by this Codec, as a function of the context to which variables will be resolved.

This method may return null, indicating that it is impossible to state anything at all on the expected number of bits. Note that if this method does return an Expression, then it will require a Resolver to resolve variables inside this expression, unless Expression.isParameterized() returns false .

Returns:
A Limbo Expression, expressing the number of bits occupied by instance loaded and stored by this Codec.

getCodecDescriptor

CodecDescriptor getCodecDescriptor()
Returns an object that is capable of rendering a description of the data structure encoded/decoded by this Codec.

Returns:
An object capable of describing the Codec.

getTypes

Class<?>[] getTypes()
Returns an array of types constructed potentially by this Codec.

Returns:
An array of types constructed potentially by this codec.

getType

Class<?> getType()
Returns the (common super) type of object constructed by this Codec.

Returns:
The (common super-) type of object constructed by this Codec.
